lab: VLSI with SPICE Code Virtual lab
lab_display_name: VLSI with SPICE Code Virtual lab
introduction: The VLSI with SPICE Code Lab provides a hands-on platform for designing and simulating transistor-level circuits using SPICE. Students develop circuit analysis skills, explore device characteristics, and gain practical experience in modeling, simulating, and verifying integrated circuit designs for VLSI applications.

experiments.name: Schematic Design Of Transistor Level Inverter using SPICE Code
Schematic Design Of Transistor Level NAND & NOR Gate using SPICE Code
Schematic Design Of Pass Transistor Logic using SPICE Code
Schematic Design Of Transistor Level XOR & XNOR Gate using SPICE Code
Schematic Design Of Multiplexer using SPICE Code
Schematic Design Of D-Latch using SPICE Code
Schematic Design Of D-Flip-Flop using SPICE Code

objective:
Key Learning Outcomes:
  • Designing Circuits: Create and simulate transistor-level circuits using SPICE.
  • Analyzing Performance: Evaluate circuit behavior, signal integrity, and power consumption.
    • Verifying Circuit Performance: Evaluate design accuracy and optimize circuit parameters for VLSI applications..

courseAlignment.description: VLSI Design is a professional core course in Electronics and Communication Engineering
universities: (PCC-EC24 and PCC-EC25) recommended in the AICTE model curriculum.
